spanishExample: Cambió de idea y cambió su estilo.
englishTranslation: She changed her mind and she changed her style.
vocabIncluded: cambiar de idea: change one's mind (idiom)
cambió: changed, he/she/it changed (Cambiar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quédese a comer.
englishTranslation: (Formal) Stay to eat.
vocabIncluded: a used between actions, as in “venir a verlo”
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: No te quedes ahí, toda persona que se queda tiene que darles dinero.
englishTranslation: Don’t stay there; every person that stays has to give them money.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
les: "them" as an indirect object ("to them", "for them")
queda: remains, he/she/it remains (Quedar, present, 3rd person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
te: "you" as an indirect object ("to you", "for you")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Puedes tener este papel para tu carta, puedes hacerla con él.
englishTranslation: You can have this paper for your letter, you can make it with it.

spanishExample: Ellos nunca cambian, pero yo cambio todo el tiempo.
englishTranslation: They never change, but I change all the time.
vocabIncluded: cambian: change, they change (Cambiar, present, 3rd person plural)
cambio: change, I change (Cambiar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No quedaba nada ahí, así que el ejército se fue.
englishTranslation: There wasn’t anything left there, so the army left.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
irse: any use of Ir with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to "leave"
quedaba: remained, he/she/it remained (Quedar, imperfect, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Cambiará su auto si se queda aquí.
englishTranslation: She will change her car if she stays here.
vocabIncluded: cambiará: will change, he/she/it will change (Cambiar, future, 3rd person)
queda: remains, he/she/it remains (Quedar, present, 3rd person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: ¡No cambies esos! Pero puedes cambiar los demás.
englishTranslation: Don’t change those! But you can change the rest.
vocabIncluded: demás: rest, as in los demás (pronoun)

spanishExample: ¡Quédate! El gobierno dijo que necesitamos tener compañía.
englishTranslation: Stay! The government said we need to have company.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
necesitamos: need, we need (Necesitar, present, 1st person plural)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: Si te quedas aquí y cambias eso, podemos hablar.
englishTranslation: If you stay here and change that, we can talk.
vocabIncluded: cambias: change, you change (Cambiar, present, 2nd person)
hablar: to speak / to talk (Hablar infinitive)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedas: remain, you remain (Quedar, present, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Yo cambié, pero ella no cambia.
englishTranslation: I changed, but she doesn’t change.
vocabIncluded: cambia: changes, he/she/it changes (Cambiar, present, 3rd person)
cambié: changed, I changed (Cambiar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Pensé que había quedado carne después de la fiesta.
englishTranslation: I thought there had been meat left after the party.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
había: "had", "he/she/it had" before a participle (Haber, imperfect, 3rd person)
pensé: thought, I thought (Pensar, preterite, 1st person)

spanishExample: Te quedarás por ello.
englishTranslation: You will stay because of it.
vocabIncluded: advanced: use of a prepositional pronoun when it’s not a person (“por ella”, “en él”, etc.)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedarás: will remain, you will remain (Quedar, future, 2nd person)

spanishExample: Ella ya no está en ello, ha cambiado mucho.
englishTranslation: She isn’t in on it anymore; she has changed a lot.
vocabIncluded: advanced: use of a prepositional pronoun when it’s not a person (“por ella”, “en él”, etc.)
ha: "has", "he/she/it has" before a participle (Haber, present, 3rd person)
ya: adverb meaning "anymore", "already", and a variety of other time-related things

spanishExample: Ella quiere que te quedes y yo también voy a quedarme.
englishTranslation: She wants you to stay and I’m also going to stay.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedes: remain, you remain (Quedar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: No cambiamos la cámara.
englishTranslation: We didn’t change the camera.
vocabIncluded: cambiamos: changed, we changed (Cambiar, preterite, 1st person plural)

spanishExample: Ambos tienen que tener cuidado con la espada.
englishTranslation: Both have to be careful with the sword.
vocabIncluded: tener cuidado: "to be careful" (idiom, lit. "to have carefulness")
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: Lo cambiamos y por eso me quedo.
englishTranslation: We’re changing it and that’s why I’m staying.
vocabIncluded: cambiamos: change, we change (Cambiar, present, 1st person plural)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedo: remain, I remain (Quedar, present, 1st person)

spanishExample: No vamos a quedarnos, pero las demás personas sí.
englishTranslation: We aren’t going to stay, but the rest of the people are.
vocabIncluded: quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
sí: adverb meaning "indeed" or otherwise providing positive emphasis
using Ir and "a" to put verbs in the future (e.g. "voy a ser")

spanishExample: Yo me quedaba ahí y por eso tuve que cambiarlo.
englishTranslation: I was staying there and that’s why I had to change it.
vocabIncluded: ahí: adverb meaning "there", especially when close to the speaker or listener
quedaba: remained, I remained (Quedar, imperfect, 1st person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
using Tener with "que" to indicate obligation

spanishExample: ¡Quédense! Cualquiera puede quedarse y tener más regalos.
englishTranslation: (Plural) Stay! Anyone can stay and have more gifts.
vocabIncluded: quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: Ese día quedó una carta y tú la cambiaste.
englishTranslation: That day there was one letter left and you changed it.
vocabIncluded: cambiaste: changed, you changed (Cambiar, preterite, 2nd person)
quedó: remained, he/she/it remained (Quedar, preterite, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Estamos cambiando nuestra casa para que puedas quedarte aquí.
englishTranslation: We’re changing our house so you can stay here.
vocabIncluded: puedas: "be able", "you be able" (Poder, subjunctive, 2nd person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: Queremos que cambie su tarjeta.
englishTranslation: We want her to change her card.
vocabIncluded: "que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
cambie: change, he/she/it change (Cambiar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Quizás quede una cosa.
englishTranslation: Maybe there will be one thing left.
vocabIncluded: quede: remain, he/she/it remain (Quedar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Si no nos quedamos podemos ir a comer, ambas son buenas ideas.
englishTranslation: If we don’t stay we can go eat; both are good ideas.
vocabIncluded: a used between actions, as in “venir a verlo”
quedamos: remain, we remain (Quedar, present, 1st person plural)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: Se quedará aquí cuando cambies todo.
englishTranslation: She’ll stay here when you change everything.
vocabIncluded: cambies: change, you change (Cambiar, subjunctive, 2nd person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedará: will remain, he/she/it will remain (Quedar, future, 3rd person)

spanishExample: Ellos no cambiaron el dinero, entonces nos quedamos sin dólares.
englishTranslation: They didn’t exchange the money, so we stayed without dollars.
vocabIncluded: cambiaron: changed, they changed (Cambiar, preterite, 3rd person plural)
quedamos: remained, we remained (Quedar, preterite, 1st person plural)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)

spanishExample: ¡Cambia eso! Quedaron demasiadas cosas.
englishTranslation: Change that! There were too many things left.
vocabIncluded: quedaron: remained, they remained (Quedar, preterite, 3rd person plural)

spanishExample: Cuando me cambie de ropa, me quedaré en el hotel.
englishTranslation: When I change my clothes, I’ll stay in the hotel.
vocabIncluded: cambie: change, I change (Cambiar, subjunctive, 1st person)
quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedaré: will remain, I will remain (Quedar, future, 1st person)

spanishExample: Ella quiere que yo tenga lo que quede en la bolsa.
englishTranslation: She wants me to have whatever is left in the bag.
vocabIncluded: "lo que": "what" as a connector between phrases
"que", meaning "that" as a conjunction (even in cases where "that" disappears in English)
quede: remain, he/she/it remain (Quedar, subjunctive, 3rd person)

spanishExample: No me quedé con ellos.
englishTranslation: I didn’t stay with them.
vocabIncluded: quedarse: any use of quedar with a reflexive pronoun, changing the meaning to stay)
quedé: remained, I remained (Quedar, preterite, 1st person)
